12322212122.content:
Hannah sat beside Luis in the dark theater, the only illumination coming from the huge screen before them.

Luis appeared caught up in the magic of the cinematography; his eyes glued to that hypnotic combination of sound and motion.

Hannah, on the otherhand, was ignorant of the scene being played out on the screen; instead her senses drinking in the warmth that eminated from the body beside her. There was a light, slightly spicy scent to him tonight that made her mouth go dry.

She felt the warm, moist feel of his words as he leaned closer to her and whispered into her ear, "They say that this is the scariest movie ever made. A dollar says you'll be huddled in my lap, hands over your ears, your face buried in my neck before the movie is half-way over."

The scene he described brought an immediate tremble to Hannah's hands. What is wrong with me! she silently demanded. It's Luis, for heaven's sake!

She turned to look at him, trying with a desperation she had never felt before, to find the boy she had once known. Thankfully, she found it in the recognizable glimmer in his eyes.

Challenge!

Instinctively Hannah heard herself reply, "In your dreams, mister! I'm planted in this seat and in this seat I'm gonna stay!"

She was in his lap before the third victim drew his last breath.
12322212122.title: The Theater

1232221212212.content: I stared up into his eyes. He started humming a song I had heard many times before. It was our song that we had written when we were still so small. "I know we'll be friends forever. We won't grow up, never ever. No one can tell me what to do. I will only listen to you." It was short, the rhymes weren't the best, whenever we sang it it was our goal sing off-key, but no one ever heard it besides us. i laughed and threw my head back. Then began singing as loudly as I could without alerting my parents down-stairs. We chanted it lots of times, laughing still. He twirled me around on his finger then reeled me back in like a fish. Then I caught his eyes. He was happy and beaming. I'd never seem him laugh so hard. Then he saw me looking. Our voices faded softly and we leaned towards each other slowly. Our noses touched gently and our lips followed suit. We felt behind us for the bed and we sat there for what felt like forever, kissing. Then finally he pulled away gently. His hands framed my face with such compassion and love that it was hard to believe it was Luis. He stared into my eyes and whispered to me calmly. "It's twelve thirty." I giggled gaily and whispered back "We missed lunch." Despite my sarcastic remark he got up and walked backwards, still staring into my eyes. "I will see you tomorrow, girly." "Night boy." I waved and made the I-love-you sign with my right hand. He backed out the window slowly and disappeared from sight into the immense darkness. I sighed and fell backwards onto the bed and into a deep restful sleep

info.brief_description: When best of friends have to choose between frienship and love
info.description:
They've been friends since they were young. They know that they have changed since then, and that they've become attracted to one another. The choice they have to make now, is to choose which path they will follow. To stay friends, or go one step further....

If you'd like to get some info on the characters....

Hannah Denny - She's sixteen, she's pretty much outgoing, but can be shy when she wants to be. She's into cheerleading. She did track back in the ninth grade, but dropped it after that year. Her and Luis have been friends since they were still in diapers. Literally. They know pretty much everything about each other, which gives them already a start on a relationship that both of their parents believe will happen, only if her and Luis let it.

Luis Armstrong - He's sixteen, and he's outgoing. He doesn't know why, but he's feeling a little shy around Hannah. He tries to be like he used to be, more outgoing, but he feels embarrassed when he does something like what's....him. He's into football, and baseball. He's scared that if they progress into a relationship, that if something goes wrong, they'll lose their friendship, and he doesn't want to lose that.
info.pretty_title: How Did I Fall in Love With You?
